title: Creamed Hot Lobster Sandwich or Lobster Poutine

instructions.1: Melt 1/2 cup butter in a large frying pan over medium-low heat; cook and stir lobster into melted butter until heated through, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
instructions.2: Whisk cornstarch and about 1 tablespoon cream together in a small bowl until smooth. Pour remaining cream into lobster, stir in cornstarch mixture; cook and stir until cream sauce comes to a simmer and thickens slightly, about 5 minutes.
instructions.3: Toast bread and spread with about 2 tablespoons butter. For each serving, pour some creamed lobster over one buttered piece of toast, top with another piece of toast, and pour more creamed lobster over the top.

questions.question: In Step 2, is the lobster from Step 1 being used?
Is lobster from Step 1 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is cornstarch from Step 2 still available in Step 3?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 2?
If we skip Step 1, is it still valid to use the lobster in Step 2?
